dasp5000.utils

Class ByteConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • dasp5000.utils.ByteConverter

  • public class ByteConverter
extends Object
    A class used to convert a audio file's data bytes into processable words. N.B.! The term 'word' is loosely used here and can actually mean a byte, a word or a double word depending on the bit depth of the encoded audio data.
    Author:
    Petri Kallio

    • Constructor Summary

      ByteConverter(int bitsPerWord, boolean bigEndian)
      Creates a new ByteToWordConverter object.

      • ByteConverter

        public ByteConverter(int bitsPerWord,
                     boolean bigEndian)
        Creates a new ByteToWordConverter object.
        Parameters:
        bitsPerWord - The amount of bits per word
        bigEndian - True if bytes are encoded as big-endian, false if little-endian

                                      boolean bigEndian)
        Parses an array of bytes into a integer.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the array of bytes to be parsed
        bytesN - the number of bytes to be parsed
        bigEndian - true is big-endian encoding, false if little-endian

        the bytes parsed as an integer

      • insertBytesToWordArray

        public void insertBytesToWordArray(byte[] bytes,
                                   int byteAmount)
        Converts the amount of bytes given in the array to words and inserts them into a DynamicArray for later use.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The bytes to be processed
        byteAmount - The amount of bytes to process

      • convertWordsToBytes
